title: Cooch Behar Dakshin (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Cooch Behar Dakshin (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Cooch%20Behar%20district">Cooch Behar district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>.
Overview.
As per orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, No. 4 Cooch Behar Dakshin (Vidhan Sabha constituency) covers <a href="Cooch%20Behar">Cooch Behar</a> municipality and Chandamari, Chilkirhat, Falimari, Ghughumari, Haribhanga, Moyamari, Patchhara, Putimari Fuleswari and <a href="Suktabari">Suktabari</a> <a href="gram%20panchayat">gram panchayat</a>s of <a href="Cooch%20Behar%20I%20%28Community%20development%20block%29">Cooch Behar I</a> <a href="Community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a>.
Cooch Behar Dakshin (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is part of No. 1 <a href="Cooch%20Behar%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Cooch Behar (Lok Sabha constituency)</a> (SC).
Election results.
2016.
In the 2016 election, Mihir Goswami of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">AITC</a> defeated his nearest rival Debasis Banik of <a href="All%20India%20Forward%20Bloc">AIFB</a>
2011.
In the 2011 election, Akshay Thakur of AIFB defeated his nearest rival Abdul Jalil Ahmed of Trinamool Congress.
1977 – 2006: Cooch Behar North constituency.
Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. In the <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006</a> and 2001 state assembly elections Dipak Chandra Sarkar of <a href="All%20India%20Forward%20Bloc">Forward Bloc</a> defeated Mihir Goswami of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a>. Mihir Goswami representing <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> had defeated <a href="Aparajita%20Goppi">Aparajita Goppi</a> of Forward Bloc in 1996. Bimal Kanti Basu of Forward Bloc defeated Mihir Goswami of Congress in 1991. Aparajita Goppi of Forward Bloc defeated Mihir Goswami of Congress in 1987, Sunil Kar of Congress in 1982 and Bimal Chandra Dhar of Congress in 1977.
1977 – 2006: Cooch Behar West constituency.
In the 2006 and 2001 state assembly elections, Akshay Thakur of <a href="All%20India%20Forward%20Bloc">Forward Bloc</a> won the Cooch Behar West seat defeating Abdul Jalil Ahmed and Soumendra Chandra Das (both of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a>) respectively. Soumindra Chandra Das of Forward Bloc defeated Abdul Jalil Ahmed representing <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> in 1996 and Ramkrishna Pal of Congress in 1991. Bimal Kanti Basu of Forward Bloc defeated Shyamal Choudhury of Congress in 1987 and 1982, and Maqsudar Rahman of Congress in 1977.
1962-1972: Cooch Behar North, South and West constituencies.
Sunil Kar of Congress won the Cooch Behar North in 1972 and 1971. Bimal Kanti Basu of Forward Bloc won it in 1969. M.R.Tar of Congress won it in 1967. Sunil Dasgupta of Forward Bloc won it in <a href="1962%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1962</a>. Santosh Kumar Roy of Congress won the Cooch Behar South seat in 1972, 1971, 1969 and 1967. Sunil Basunia of Forward Bloc won the seat in 1962. Rajani Das of Congress won the Cooch Behar West seat in 1972 and 1971. Prasenjit Barman of Congress won it in 1969 and 1967. The seat was not there prior to 1967.
1951 & 1957: Cooch Behar constituency.
Cooch Behar was a joint seat in <a href="1957%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1957</a>. It was won by Maziruddin Ahmed and Satish Chandra Roy Singha (both of Congress). In <a href="1952%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">independent India's first election in 1951</a>, Maziruddin Ahmed and Jatindra Nath Singha Sarkar (both of Congress) won the Cooch Behar joint seat.
